Tommy Jarvis.Action: Drives recklessly with intense determination to face Jason, involving Hawes against his hesitation.
Cold and determined to send Jason to hell, shows no warmth in speech but takes responsibility seriously.
Determines Jason's grave precisely and initiates digging despite ominous weather and evident tension.
Shows frustration but does not give up looking for the grave, maintaining focus.
Feels deep terror but continues with the task without hesitation.
Works feverishly and cooperates with Hawes to exhume Jason's body, showing determination and shared effort.
Exhumes the decomposing corpse of Jason despite the revolting nature of the task, showing courage but also a cold, focused determination with a building hatred.
Remembers traumatic past while showing violent rage.
Acts with vengeful hatred toward Jason, ignoring Hawes's concern.
Grabs a spear-like fence post and uses it effectively to stab Jason repeatedly, showing decisive and focused action.
Acts without explaining his plan to Hawes, who is confused and alarmed, indicating some lack of communication or broader strategic thinking.
Expresses contempt toward Jason by saying 'Fuck you, Jason' and tosses the mask into the grave, indicating release of personal anger.
Responds to Hawes' worry by calmly continuing to act to resolve the situation rather than succumbing to fear.
Carefully puts on gloves before handling the hot spear, showing a measure of prudence and responsibility.
Decides to physically jump into Jason's grave and struggle to remove the spear despite obvious danger, showing dedication and commitment to protecting others.
Does not acknowledge or comfort Hawes when he expresses fear and desire to leave, focusing instead on the task.
Drives the spear into Jason's heart, showing determination and skill to end the threat.
Calmly picks up Jason's hockey mask to symbolically reject the nightmare, showing emotional control.
After spear is electrified by lightning, quickly dons gloves to safely handle it and attempts to remove spear despite difficulty.
Jumps down into Jason's grave to gain leverage for spear removal, demonstrating resourcefulness and bravery.
Fails to successfully pull the spear out due to it being lodged deep in the coffin, shows physical limitation but persists.
Removes gloves and throws them to Hawes before climbing out, indicating trust and sharing resources in a moment of danger.
Fights desperately to survive and attempts to use matches and gasoline against Jason, showing determination but focused on self-preservation rather than others.
Fights off Jason with strength and quick thinking to kick him back and climb out of the grave.
Immediately uses available resources by grabbing a gas can and attempting to douse Jason to try to stop him.
Searches his pockets for matches to ignite the gasoline despite the heavy rain.
Panics while struggling to light matches in a downpour, showing some desperation and difficulty.
Horrified and weaponless, he runs like hell to escape danger.
Leaps from his truck and races for the sheriff's office to presumably seek help.
Bursts into the sheriff's office, startling the sheriff.
Horrified and weaponless, he runs like hell from Jason instead of fighting or defending himself.
Races out of the cemetery to his pickup and quickly drives away to presumably seek help or safety.
Leaps from his truck and races for the sheriff's office, taking initiative to find help.
Bursts into the sheriff's office, indicating urgency and decisiveness, though possibly lacking stealth or subtlety.
Instinctively raises hands to show he means no harm when threatened by the sheriff.
Quickly shares urgent information about danger to try to protect others.
Remains calm and tries to sound rational despite stress and hostility.
Quickly tries to convince the sheriff about Jason's threat despite being met with hostility.
Appears highly emotional and somewhat desperate while trying to be rational.
Fails to immediately gain the sheriff's trust or cooperation.
Explodes in frustration and forcibly grabs a rifle to stop Jason, showing urgency to protect others.
Struggles and pleads for others to listen and believe his warnings despite being misunderstood and restrained.
His aggressive and desperate behavior causes conflict with law enforcement, showing less patience and tolerance.
Explodes with urgency and grabs a rifle to confront the threat of Jason.
Fights the deputies and is disarmed and imprisoned, failing to persuade others of the danger.
Paces cell in wild frustration, pleads earnestly with sheriff to believe him and to take action about Jason's burial.
Defiantly insists sheriff listen despite being dismissed rudely and threatened, showing sincerity and concern.
Paces the cell in wild frustration and insists the sheriff check the cemetery to verify his claim.
Speaks defiantly to the sheriff despite being told to rest and stop causing trouble.
No direct action or involvement in this excerpt; others attempt to confront Jason, but fail.
Expresses concern for missing camp counselors and urges others to take action.
Sincerely assures Megan he is not dangerous despite being a prisoner.
Expresses a bad feeling about his missing friends and tries to persuade others to take action, showing awareness and concern.
Grips the cell bars and speaks sincerely to Megan, displaying calmness and confidence despite being a prisoner.
Fails to convince the sheriff initially and is dismissed angrily, indicating limited influence or effectiveness in the moment.
Sincerely assures Megan and others that he is not dangerous.
Shows concern by trying to warn the sheriff about Jason’s imminent return.
Tries to communicate despite being ignored and dismissed by the sheriff.
Warns the sheriff and others that Jason will return to the original camp area, showing awareness and understanding of Jason's behavior.
Is dismissed and ignored by the sheriff despite his warnings, indicating his inability to persuade or assert effectively to those in authority.
Pushes off the bars in frustration and paces the cell like a caged animal.
Pushes off the bars in frustration and paces the cell like a caged animal.
Drives with incredible anxiety while being followed by police, showing inner turmoil.
Drives anxiously but purposefully to evade police and continue his mission.
Shows intense anxiety and fear indicating emotional struggle that could impair effectiveness.
Decides to head toward the cemetery to possibly prove he's telling the truth, showing determination and hope.
Evades police by speeding up and ignoring sirens, risking a chase rather than cooperating.
Decides to make a sudden turn toward the cemetery despite police pursuit, showing initiative under pressure.
Gets nervous when hearing the siren but chooses to speed up instead of pulling over.
Leaps out of the truck and races into the cemetery hoping to convince others he is telling the truth.
Tries to convince the sheriff to see the disturbed grave, shows desperation and concern.
Struggles against being handcuffed and restrained, insisting on showing the truth.
Insists on showing the sheriff the disturbed grave despite growing hostility and threat of violence.
Attempts to approach the grave despite being physically restrained and threatened with a gun.
Fails to recognize the danger of escalating the situation with law enforcement.
Demanding to know who covered up Jason's grave, insisting Jason is not in his coffin and yelling for the truth.
Stares coldly into sheriff's eyes without reacting emotionally when being aggressively confronted.
Waits patiently and quietly after being treated harshly by law enforcement, does not retaliate or escalate situation.
Stares coldly and calmly at the sheriff despite harsh treatment; does not react impulsively or emotionally.
Rushing toward his old pickup with determination after being released.
Is treated by law enforcement as irresponsible and possibly mentally unstable (‘nut house you belong in’), indicating others perceive him as lacking responsibility.
Calls Megan to discuss a plan to stop Jason and seeks help from her father, showing concern and willingness to cooperate.
Is preoccupied and serious during the phone call, indicating focus rather than emotional distance.
Initiates a phone call to seek help and explain his plan, demonstrating forethought and strategic thinking.
Is found in a 'badly sabotaged old phone booth', indicating a less-than-ideal choice of location which could reflect a potential oversight or compromised preparation.
Shares critical information with Megan about Jason's whereabouts, showing trust and openness.
Feels worried about involving Megan in danger, indicating care and concern for her safety.
Immediately recognizes the threat Jason poses and communicates this clearly over the phone, showing awareness and urgency.
Provides Megan with an approximate location despite uncertainty, demonstrating resourcefulness under pressure.
Shows visible worry and hesitation about involving Megan but still proceeds, indicating some internal conflict but ultimate resolution to act.
Adamantly tells Megan he can't do this with him because it's too dangerous, and asks to borrow her car.
Adamantly insists on borrowing a car to face danger, showing awareness of the situation's risk and taking action.
Refuses to let Megan come along, citing danger and responsibility for past deaths, showing protective seriousness.
Irritated response to Megan's suggestion, initially shutting her down.
Ultimately listens to Megan's plan, sighs exasperatedly but cooperates by moving the truck.
Insists on taking responsibility for the dangerous situation, wary about involving Megan.
Shows irritation and hesitation when Megan pushes for action, indicating some internal conflict or stress.
Ultimately complies with Megan's suggestion to hide the truck, showing flexibility and willingness to cooperate in a practical way.
Shoot Megan a dry, somewhat sarcastic look, making a joke about the car's speed.
Looks at Megan for a plan during a tense situation, showing trust in her.
Identifies the police roadblock in advance and communicates it clearly.
Relies on Megan to execute the escape plan rather than taking control himself, showing some passivity.
Calmly asks Megan not to do anything crazy while she drives recklessly to escape cops.
Shows deadpan acceptance of Megan's driving and orders, putting his head back down and staring out.
Calmly advises Megan not to do anything crazy despite the dangerous police chase, showing composure under pressure.
Chooses to stay down on Megan's lap instead of involving himself more actively during the chase.
Attempts to be discreet and avoid discomfort during Megan's wild driving, showing patience and tolerance.
Looks at Megan with disbelief at her reckless behavior but does not openly reprimand her.
Maintains composure and quietly assesses the dangerous situation despite Megan's wild driving.
Accepts precarious physical position (sprawled on the floorboard) without panicking, indicating focus.
Expresses dread but mentally acknowledges the situation is escalating and not hopeless.
Pleading with the sheriff, trying to reason and de-escalate the situation.
Expresses frustration and tries to point out an important detail about the disconnected phone, indicating concern and awareness.
Points out the significance of the disconnected phone line, indicating awareness of potential trouble.
Does not act or intervene meaningfully when accused by the sheriff or during the tension, remaining passive.
Persistently insists Jason did the murders and asks the sheriff for details despite being dismissed.
Reacting emotionally by slamming fists against the bars and saying 'Damn.' after Megan supports his alibi.
Sits on his jail cot, head in hands, hopeless.
Glances up amazed at Megan's supportive gesture and silently asks for confirmation.
Sits on his jail cot with head in hands, hopeless.
His eyes widen, amazed at Megan's sketch and he asks for confirmation before believing it.
Thanks Megan for helping him but insists on finishing what he started.
Throws up his hands in mild frustration before getting in the car.
Insists on finishing the task despite being helped out, demonstrates determination and acceptance of responsibility.
Initially throws up his hands before getting into the car, indicating some hesitation.
Drives urgently to try to save someone, showing determination and concern.
Explains the reason behind his actions to Megan, patiently answering her doubts.
Drives urgently and purposefully to confront Jason, showing determination and awareness of the stakes.
Explains that the only effective way to stop Jason is to return him to his original resting place rather than using a gun, demonstrating knowledge and strategic thinking.
Correctly identifies the lake as Crystal Lake, showing attention to detail and grasp of the situation's history.
Carries a heavy sack to help and quickly chases after Megan to protect her.
Worried about Megan and tries to stop her from running into danger.
Grabs the heavy sack from the car and tries to follow Megan after she runs into the counselors' cabin, showing concern and readiness to act.
Expresses worry (saying 'I hope so') about the arrival of help, indicating uncertainty but awareness of danger.
Unable to prevent Megan from rushing into the blood-spattered cabin alone despite calling out to her to wait.
Looks in on the children, relieved to see them safe, then quickly leaves to act.
Races toward the dock lugging heavy chains and padlocks to stop Jason.
Quickly assesses the situation on seeing the murdered cop, immediately rejects the compromised boat, and opts for the safer alternative.
Carries a heavy satchel with presumably important equipment and urgently searches the lakeshore for a tool or solution, showing preparedness and determination.
Struggles to roll a heavy rock to secure the boat, instructs Megan to call for assistance and an ambulance, showing concern for others.
Struggles to roll a large, heavy rock toward the boat while simultaneously organizing Megan to call for help using the car radio
Yells clear instructions to Megan to use the car radio to call for help and an ambulance
Pushes off alone in the boat to confront Jason, telling Megan to get to safety with the kids.
Speaks impatiently to Megan when she urges him to help look for Jason.
Stands in boat waving arms and calling Jason to come after him, distracting Jason to save Megan and the children.
Rowing out into the lake, leaving Megan momentarily alone near Jason's danger.
Starts rowing out into the lake to draw Jason away from others, attempts to protect the kids and Megan by distracting Jason.
Stands awkwardly in the boat waving his arms to lure Jason, showing some visible uncertainty but persistence.
Calls out to Jason, confidently trying to take responsibility and be the one Jason targets instead of others.
Keeps taunting Jason to come for him, drawing danger onto himself.
Ignores Megan's warning and does not immediately act to protect himself despite the danger.
Taunts Jason to come for him, showing confidence in face of danger.
Sits down calmly in the boat and prepares the chain noose despite sweating and nervousness.
Does not immediately escape when Jason approaches; instead, holds position to execute a plan.
Panics and yells at Jason shortly before attempting to trap him.
Sweating profusely and grimacing, but still carries out the plan to prepare the noose.
Goes crazy looking around after Jason submerges, showing loss of composure momentarily.
Struggles fiercely against Jason to control the noose and ultimately traps him underwater despite personal danger.
Holds the noose over Jason as he resurfaces, preparing to trap him.
Loses balance and drops the noose to the bottom of the boat, causing the hull to crack and leak water.
Struggles skillfully to retrieve the noose with his foot despite Jason's attacks and the boat filling with water.
Forces the noose over Jason’s head under extreme pressure and physical struggle.
Allows the hull to be pulled open and is dragged underwater together with Jason.
Fights desperately underwater to free himself and stop Jason, risking his life.
Though struggling, does not give up resisting Jason, showing commitment to protecting others.
No indication of hostility toward friends or selfishness during struggle.
Remains unconscious underwater and requires rescue and resuscitation.
Survives the underwater attack and eventually recovers, allowing him to recognize and confirm Jason's defeat.
